website_summaries.verdict: Whether you are a serious cook or just love blending foods for trying new concoctions, this top-of-the-line Oster blender has everything you need, from speed to power to reliable customer support.
pros: Has an impressive feature set capable of blending nearly any food items to perfection, including variable speeds, 3 programmed settings, and 1400 watts of power that produce excellent results
cons: Large and takes up significant space on a kitchen counter or in storage
most that are backed by the warranty
A bit on the loud side

customer_reviews.title: Works great till the jar kills itself
customer_reviews.text: Got the blender in 2015 and have used it a lot in the last 2 years for smoothies. Like many of the reviews have talked about the blade on the jar failed today and started smoking. As a normal blender think its great, but if you use the smoothie button a lot expect it to fail on you. The smoothie function uses the ability to spin the blade in both directions to suck down all the fruit. This works great but ends up killing the jar. The warranty covers the motor but not the jar and you can no longer buy the jar anywhere. If you want this for making smoothie’s pick something else.
customer_reviews.author: David Petersen

customer_reviews.title: NOT Stainless - will rust immediately!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed to see that the "gear" socket on the bottom of the pitcher is MADE OF NON STAINLESS STEEL. After reading reviews on The Wirecutter, I thought surely this is the world's best blender, but that's a basic, and irredeemable, design flaw. A single wash-and-dry cycle later, and there's ugly rust all over the place! And I don't mean a little discoloration, I mean RUST, bright orange rust that wipes off easily and stains things (and yes it's RUST, as in iron oxide, I'm not mistaking it for something else.) Seriously, for a kitchen implement that cost nearly $200, how on earth can they not make it out of stainless steel? I'm aghast.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Smith

customer_reviews.title: motor and base smoked and burned up
customer_reviews.text: Likes: - powerful to blend smoothies and hummus Dislikes: - Plastic base bearings burned up and filled the kitchen with smoke (Oster sent us a new one) - Motor base just recently started smoking and there is a dark black substance where the top of the base sits - Oster does not have good customer service. I waited on the phone for 32 minutes and then the tech hung up on me. When I submitted a request online, I had to re-submit the same data and pictures 2 more times and I haven't heard back since. I would not buy an Oster again...spend the money and get a VitaMix
customer_reviews.author: Dominic "Slice" Teich

customer_reviews.title: Stay away and ignore all the professional reviews that recommend this blender
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more disappointed (and my 5 year old daughter who was so excited to have a smoothie tonight as well). The knob is so poorly built. When you turn from the off position to Pulse or On it feel like grinding inside the base. The whole base is plastic which I knew but the plastic feels like cheap quality. I'm just so surprised right now because so many professional reviews are recommending this as a top notch blender but I completely see how there are several complaints of this blender breaking after 6-12 months. I'm returning immediately and will probably look at a Ninja.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Torres

customer_reviews.title: After about 5-7 months, the jar bottom/blade parts begin to deteriorate
customer_reviews.text: The blade assembly connected to the jar (which is all one connected piece) begins to leak. Basically the assembly becomes loosely detached from the actual jar. You can tighten this assembly all you want but the shear torque of the blender keeps the assembly loose and gives way to leaking and a good deal of clean-up. I asked for replacement jar from Oster but due to the pandemic, any parts from China or Germany are taking much longer than usual and this particular jar is out of stock. Replacements will arrive supposedly in 4 months or so. I can't wait that long. Will likely upgrade to what Wirecutter recommends.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Useless warranty
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of using this for smoothies a couple times new a week, the motor has failed. Our smoothies were made with thawed fruits and no ice, so we weren’t using it hard. I have been calling the warranty line for 2 weeks and every time I get a recorded message saying “we are experiencing high call volumes, we can’t take your call right now. Click.”
customer_reviews.author: smashley

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the vitamix
customer_reviews.text: Smells like crisping circuitry when operating. The blender is inexpensive, but new jars with the replacement bearing assembly are not. In regular use (given this appliance’s target market) you will buy another jar before the comparable vitamix is out of warranty. At that point you will have already paid out the comparable upfront cost of the more expensive blender. It’s also very noisy, but I mostly expect that from a kilowatt plus blender.
customer_reviews.author: IFK

customer_reviews.title: Leaking after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought based on Wirecutter reviews and used primarily for smoothies, wish I could return it. It started leaking last week. I'm also disappointed with how long it takes to blend frozen fruit, there are often big chunks of fruit that I have to pick out after several minutes in the blender. I would've just splurged on the Vitamix if I hadn't read the reviews saying this was the runner up. Wasted $150 on this, don't do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely until it smokes
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for making smooth smoothies with Kale, Carrots, Oats, ice cubes, and fruits, no issue. But last week, the seal of the grinding blade gave up and became brittle and degraded. The last time I used it the friction of the grinding blade heated the seal to the point of smoking and the smoke actually penetrated inside the blender jar and in to the smoothie. Gave the customer care a call, and since the blender has 7 year warranty, they replaced my blender. Let's see who long this one lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh Yadav

customer_reviews.title: Lasted us 4 or 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, made some awesome smoothies. The base is still working, but the bottom of the jar is cracked and leaks, and I can't find a new jar online, so we need to get another. Not sure which kind we will get, but hopefully one that has replacement parts available.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, blends even better
customer_reviews.text: Great design and doesn’t look “plasticky”. Excellent power and easy to clean. The base shroud seems to resonate or amplify the sound of the motor on our granite counter top...so while I am very happy with the unit so far and the amazingly smooth texture it yields when blending smoothies...make sure everyone is out of bed before flipping the switch!
customer_reviews.author: Kirk J. Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as a VitaMix for way less $
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I purchased the Oster instead of paying $500 for a VitaMix, based on a recommendation from Sweet Home Reviews. It was a great choice for me. I have used it for smoothies, dressings, dips, and soups. Everything has turned out great. It's easy to clean and doesn't take up too much room in the cabinet. And the recipe book that came with it has some great recipes! My mother has an Oster blender that has been running for 30 years, so I hope mine lasts that long! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee S.

customer_reviews.title: Performs very well but there are no parts available, so usabiilty is hindered
customer_reviews.text: For a high-end product that has a very powerful engine which costs more than the average blender, the service and parts availability is non-existent. Have a look at the Oster website for the parts for this blender (BLSTVB-RV0-000) and, for example, the replacement jar (172873-000-000) hasn't been available for months. Repeat the same exercise for other websites popular for replacement parts. On top of this, I commented on their site about this exact problem only to have them reject the comment (I wasn't remotely rude, by the way).
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lebron

customer_reviews.title: Not durable & tamper is too long
customer_reviews.text: This blender is not durable. Mine broke after 1.5 years of use, and my family only used it once to twice weekly to make smoothies. The tamper was flawed, as it was too long, and could easily get ground while blending. I recently purchased a Vitamix Explorian 310, and I'm so happy with it! The tamper for Vitamix is buoyant, so no worries about it getting ground up. I wish I would've bought a Vitamix from the get-go, definitely worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela A. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Use this blender mostly for sauces, dips and dressings but have blended frozen drinks and it’s handled everything reliably. The fact that the blades and jar are one unit does make it tricky to get all the blended food out if it is thicker, like hummus, and makes it less simple to clean. It’s also very loud. But I feel it does the job for the price.
customer_reviews.author: WeeLittleSoul

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: The blender doesn't blend well and it is extremely loud (louder than any other blender I've used). It couldn't handle blending spinach, leaving it stringy and bits and pieces. The third time I used the blender, it stopped and started smoking. A cheap $30 blender could do a better job. I'm very dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Wirecutter review, build quality, and noise level.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in wirecutter recommendation. Driveshaft broke after 2 years. Obviously not up to frozen fruit smoothies. Disappointed for >150. Another appliance that isn’t built to high enough quality. Stay away. Have just replaced with Vitamix 5200. Hope to see better performance and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blender started on fire!
customer_reviews.text: A follow up to my initial positive review. As many other reviews indicated there is a serious problem with the gears and blade. I did not know this until going back to Amazon to see when I purchased this blender - approximately four years ago. There was warning, and this morning as I was making a smoothly my blender caught on fire! This is completely unacceptable and dangerous. Not only do I NOT recommend this product I believe that this item creates a serious safety hazard. I just ordered a Vitamix from Costco, which is what I should have done in the first place instead of trying to save a little money buying a “knock off.”
customer_reviews.author: Hedy

customer_reviews.title: Oster VERSA 1400-watt is a fantastic value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic value. You get everything the more expensive Vitamix and Blendtec machines offer for a lot less money including a full 7-year warranty! Very powerful — completely satisfied with the performance and the savings! I have both the low profile jar and the tall jar. I prefer the low profile jar because it feels better built especially in the lid area. I really can't see any reason for the tall jar if you have the low profile jar.
customer_reviews.author: S.E. Powers

customer_reviews.title: They stand by their warranty
customer_reviews.text: My blender started smoking after exactly 1 year. I called their warranty department, they checked the serial numbers, and sent me a new blender out right away. They also sent return postage to return the defective blender. One of the reasons I bought this blender was because of the 7 year warranty I'm happy to report Oster backed their warranty. The blender works good for making smoothies which is all we use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: It leaks at the bottom
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, and I like the short cup. I use it every day to mix protein shakes. After about 2 months I noticed foul smell where the cup joins the base. Upon closer inspection, it turned out it was leaking a bit through the blade assembly. After every use there would be a little residue on the outside of the bottom of the cup. After not using it for a week (been away on vacation) the blades became really hard to spin. The motor makes unhealthy noise and clearly overloaded. Looking at replacement options...
customer_reviews.author: Elena.st

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a very good blender, and was looking at Blend Tec or Vita Mix. Well...they are both very expensive and when I saw the reviews on this blender I thought I'd take a chance. LOVE IT!!!! It pulverizes vegetables for kick-ass smoothies. Makes the creamiest soups ever. It performs incredibly well and is such a bargain. I am so happy I went with this. Many people buy Vita Mix because they're 'cool' or 'in style' or because celebrity chefs tout them....but, this blender will give you everything a Vita Mix will.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Best Blender/Value ratio you will find
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a Vitamix or a higher powered Ninja (or a Blendtec) and purchased this to replace my $20 Oster blender. The first time I made a pina colada or smoothie (or anything really) in this blender it feels like I just drove off the lot with a Ferarri after trading in my Aveo. I've had this for a week or so and it has demolished anything I've thrown at it. Given it is priced like a mid-grade blender and a fraction of the cost of those other competitors makes this an easy choice for someone who doesn't use it for a living.... and even then it is probably worth it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Neff

customer_reviews.title: absolutely NO regrets on this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine!! My mom has a Vitamix that I've used & mysister has Blendtec & I'd say this rivals them at a fraction of the price. I've used this daily since it was delivered & sometimes multiple times in one day and I LOVE it. I've been able to make so many recipes that i couldnt make before with a regular blender & my husband thought I'd gone to one of those "fancy smoothie places" the first time i made a smoothie with it...& it even had cauliflower leaves & stems blended in! Worth every penny...as are the previously mentioned blenders but when you don't have that many pennies this one does the job!!
customer_reviews.author: MTR Fan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome blender!
customer_reviews.text: This is a substantial blender ready to mix and chop up veggies. Love the look, love the well-made design. Is worth the money! I looked at a lot of blenders and needed one to blend veggies into a creamy soup without chunks and without blowing up the motor. This is a fabulous blender!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Lid is disintegrating, not the best at catching all ingredients in smoothie.
customer_reviews.text: This blender does not capture things like flax seeds and chunks of frozen kale like I've heard a Vitamix does. But my husband insisted we keep it anyway. Now, 2 years later, the black rubber from the lid is leaving behind pieces of rubber everytime I replace the lid onto the jar. Pretty sure that's not a nutritional benefit to my smoothies. Also, washing in the dishwasher is not a great option, as there is a big well when turned upside down that collects the water from the dishwasher. So I did that once, and have only hand washed it since. So....the lid should not be desintigrating. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY LIKE IT, IT MAKES ITEMS REALLY SMOOTH( I MAINLY USE IT FOR GREEN JUICES) . HOWEVER I HEAR IT DOES NOT LAST VERY LONG. I PLAN TO TAKE VERY GOOD CARE OF IT AND NOT BLEND ICE, OR FROZEN FRUIT. GREAT SERRATED STEEL BLADE. GREAT BUYING EXPERIENCE. ******UPDATE** IT'S MAY 2018 JUST LIKE OTHERS HAVE SAID MY BLENDER JAR IS LEAKING. IT LEAKS ALL OVER THE BLENDER BASE. IT'S SO ANNOYING, IT HAS NOT EVEN BEEN THAT LONG FROM WHEN I BOUGHT IT. I WILL TRY TO GET A NEW JAR FROM THE BLENDER COMPANY. BUT I DO NOT RECOMMEND, JUST BUY A VITAMIX.
customer_reviews.author: LUV AMAZON

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this product so far!
customer_reviews.text: Totally re-writing my review. I bought this item Dec. 30th of last year. This morning, 8/27/15, I turned it on to make a smoothie and it stopped. It made kind of a funny high pitched sound and just quit. It won't turn on - the button won't even light. Wow. Very embarrassing! There is a reset switch under the base. When I pushed in the reset button, added the pitcher to the stand and turned it on, it worked fine. No idea why the reset button, but apparently it sucked too much juice and shut itself off! Still works great, just had a scare there!
customer_reviews.author: jenni

customer_reviews.title: Rather good blender.
customer_reviews.text: It crushes ice like a mythical beast and blends batters like a boss, but its slowest speed is still pretty fast, as noted by America's Test Kitchen. Oster warrants it for seven years and sells spare parts, but be careful not to buy parts intended for their other blenders because they're incompatible with this higher-powered one.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Elliott

customer_reviews.title: A good Oster product
customer_reviews.text: So far I have absolutely no complaints other than the fact that my family uses it more than I do...which I suppose is a good thing. They rave about it. Clean-up isn't too bad but do make sure to rinse it out immediately after use to make sure it doesn't become a hassle. The cup is heavy with strong construction and the base is very solid. I love the pre-settings for my smoothies. Just be sure to let the entire setting finish (it's a two-stage blending that will pause after the first). I'll update if any of this changes but it seems like a very good buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: A Fish

customer_reviews.title: It lasted 15 months
customer_reviews.text: Our blender was always noisy, but after 15 months the noise was intolerable. It seems it is about to quit. The blending action was always good and the different blending features were handy, but not really necessary. The jar is very easy to clean as nothing seems to adhere to it if it is washed immediately after use. I would not buy it again as I feel the price was beyond the benefit for 15 months. Also, the sealing rim on the lid began to separate after about 6 months. It was necessary to carefully reposition it often within the groove designed to accept it.
customer_reviews.author: L. BUENO

customer_reviews.title: Zero customer support
customer_reviews.text: Bought this blender 2 years ago. The blender is great! The company and customer service is not! The jar fell recently and now has a big crack in it. I looked everywhere for a replacement. Called Oster , first the guy told me they don’t sell them separately. Then he said they do, but they’re $120 for just the jar. I said for an extra $30 I could by a whole unit again. He said that’s the best option. I can’t believe a plastic jar with a blade inside costs $120. I mentioned the bad reviews to him and he said “We get that a lot. Customers don’t get what they want”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jar is too large, other than that it works well
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. I just used it to make coconut milk from coconut shreds. You still have to strain the milk but I haven't found anyone on-line who is claiming you could make coconut milk without straining. Works well with berries in it for smoothies. We've had this for about 6 months. I think the container is a bit larger than I would personally like so I still use my bullet blender quite frequently. I do wish I had bought something with a smaller jar. I thought the pouring spout was a bit too wide also. I hope Oster makes a smaller version - maybe they do and I just bought the wrong one.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre to bad, ended in smoke.
customer_reviews.text: Used it for two years. Compared to a low end vitamix, the versa does not blend frozen fruit as efficiently or effectively, and it overheats relatively easily. I'm writing this review because today this blender is no longer usable: it smokes and it smells terrible. I used my mothers' vitamix extensively before I chose to go the budget route; I would rather have paid double the price to avoid the frustration with this machine over the past two years, not to mention the inhalation of potentially toxic smoke when it malfunctioned.
customer_reviews.author: Horowitz

customer_reviews.title: ... a protein shake guy and someone that loves a good blender this one is top notch for the money ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok so as a protein shake guy and someone that loves a good blender this one is top notch for the money you pay. Plenty of power to blend anything the blender makes nut butters great, I will say though best to purchase a second pitcher for nut butters makes the plastic hazy no functional issue just looks ugly so I keep that one under counter and pretty one on the unit. As compared to a vitamax and such power wise it's got it I would say though that the vitamax motor is probably of a higher commercial quality but for a home blender save 400 dollars and buy this for 230 you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: jamie sturm

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall a VERY good blender... The preset modes are awesome.. I primarily use this for smoothies but I am excited to try making nut butters and soup with it! Cleans easily and it looks and feels sturdy! I will say I have found the stray blueberry or piece of banana at the bottom of my smoothies after running it on the "smoothie" setting.. I'm sure a bit of after the fact pulsing would fix that but I'd give this a 9.2 out of 10! great price though!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Arpag

customer_reviews.title: Great Blender!
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. I make smoothies about every day, and this blender has made it really easy. It's cut the time in half and blends really well. I like that it has different speeds, which really blends the fruit/veggies well. The top opens to allow a stirrer that comes with to help when I have stocked it full. The only bummer is that it's not dishwasher safe, so I have to wash it by hand. I usually do this immediately once my smoothie is done, so it's become a pretty quick process. I'm impressed with how well it's held up and everything we've mixed is done SO quickly! For the price, I'm happy and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Great blender short life
customer_reviews.text: Great blender short life. I used the blender a couple times a week if that, to make smoothies. A couple weeks ago I went to use it and nothing. Did reset let it sit several times and still nothing no power no light nothing. I thought maybe if it sits for a few day it would start again, but again nothing! Bought it Dec 2016 and its now April 2018 almost year and a half and almost $200 down the drain SAVE YOUR MONEY DONT BUY my last blender lasted 20 years and kids using it everyday
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: No jar replacement
customer_reviews.text: The only problem with this blender is you can not find a replacement jar anywhere!! Mine worked perfectly until blade mechanism got broken. It is impossible to take it apart to replace the blades. Poor design for a good brand like Oster. Never think those guys could design a blender with this problem
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Blender
customer_reviews.text: I replaced one of the cheaper $30-$40 Oster blenders you can find in most big box stores. What a difference. This thing handles anything I throw at it. I primarily use this to make my once (sometimes twice) a day protein smoothies. I can put all of my ingredients in this at once, including ice, and it will take care of it. Texture is smooth and it seems to even handle things like kale pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cleary

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service. I am not a happy customer.
customer_reviews.text: Three years with normal use and the motor is burned out? Powerful 1400 Watt motor??? 7 year warranty!!! Do not buy this one. (Powerful 1400 Watt motor 64-ounce BPA-Free Tritan Jar Three programmed settings (Smoothies, Dips/Spreads and Soup) and variable speed dial to instantly adjust speed as needed Stainless steel blade spins at Over 250 mph thoroughly blending ingredients so recipes turn out perfect every time Includes 2 color cookbooks with recipes to inspire you; 7 year warranty Dimensions: H: 12.1" x W:16.8" x L:11.6", Cord Length: 16")
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I rarely post reviews but I've been disappointed with this blender
customer_reviews.text: I rarely post reviews but I've been disappointed with this blender. The unit burned up after very little usage and less than a year of ownership. It's dead now, and I threw it away. The bottom of the pitcher requires a special tool to unscrew and clean. If you hand tighten it, it slips. I found it difficult to clean in general. The base is very large. If you don't have large cabinets, it's going to be an issue. Finally, I found the unit loud. I had a $30 Braun blender that I was more pleased with than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McCrary

customer_reviews.title: this is a GREAT purchase. the machine is sturdy and the recipes ...
customer_reviews.text: this is a GREAT purchase. the machine is sturdy and the recipes that come with the buy are terrific. I use it for healthy smoothies with veggies and fruit between 1-3 times/day. it makes super good soups- the carrot ginger soup is amazing. works like a champ. note- if you make your smoothies with hard veggies like carrots, then use the smoothie setting + another minute on high speed- makes perfect smoothies every time. I cannot believe the value of this machine. my friends with vitamix are amazed!
customer_reviews.author: drivethecar

customer_reviews.title: 7 year warranty is costly
customer_reviews.text: I also bought this blender to make my smoothies, 1 per day, and sometimes not. So average use 5 times per week. It was just 1 1/2 years old when I started noticing the grease leaking out of the bottom of the of the pitcher. I have called Oster and have been told to mail it back at my expense and they will replace it. Well, I live in a rural area of Michigan and it will be at least 40 mile drive to drop it off with either UPS or Fed Ex. For the money I spent I should have added another $100. 00 and gotten a vita-mix.
customer_reviews.author: lhkAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Broke After 2 Years But It Has A 7 Year Warranty!
customer_reviews.text: The good news: Good, powerful, stable blender. The bad news: It broke after 2 years. The bearing in the pitcher seized and burned out the motor. The good news: It has a 7 year warranty. Oster is replacing it for free. The bad news: It'll take a week. The good news: I can wait a week.
customer_reviews.author: Hal Feinstein

customer_reviews.title: Smoothies Galore!
customer_reviews.text: I started a new Green Smoothie diet earlier in the year. It took me a few times to figure out the right combination when blending my frozen fruit and greens to get the correct consistency. I have not tried anything else in it but have been pleased with the results. I got the odd shaped jar so that it would git under my cabinets on the counter. Excellent investment but with my new eating habits I don't use it for anything else but smoothies. One day I will venture out and make something else in it. The recipe book that came with it has some great things in it too, can't wait to try them one day!
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Broken within 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this in May 2017. Worked great for a few months, making smoothies multiple times a week. But the bottom of the plastic pitcher gradually developed a long crack and now it leaks everywhere. According to customer service, this is considered "normal wear" and is not covered by their 7-year warranty, so I'll have to order a replacement pitcher for $75. No, thanks. I will not spend any more money with a company that thinks it is normal for their products to break down after a few months of moderate use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would love a replacement cookbook and directions
customer_reviews.text: I would love it, but it keeps turning off when I'm blending. I was hoping to read up more on the product, but the nice directions and cookbook that was included was literally ripped to shreds my Lab puppy. I'm hoping to get a replacement book and directions for the product and will update my review once I can see what's going on.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Blender
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this blender for about a week but I use it to make a smoothy each morning and I am so happy with this purchase! Had a ninja and it broke after only a year and a half (and didn't work that great anyways) and so far the versa is SOOOOO MUCH BETTER. Have also used a Vitamix in the past and considered getting one again but I don't like the look of them and they are so expensive that I thought I would give this one a shot after reading reviews. Very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Rehm

customer_reviews.title: Great blender!
customer_reviews.text: The Oster Vers Pro Series Blender is a terrific blender. It's easy to operate and clean. The program functions make it very easy to use for most tasks such as making smoothies. It's large container is easy use. It's a large blender but fits easily under our standard sized kitchen cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: John McGill

customer_reviews.title: We have been blending with this thing like crazy since we got it a few months back
customer_reviews.text: We have been blending with this thing like crazy since we got it a few months back. It has been doing a great job, and blends things far smoother than our previous (basic) blender. It isn't as smooth as my neighbors vitamix, but gets you ~90% there for ~50% of the price. The included bat is pretty cheap, but does the job. At least you don't have to buy it separately. I'm very satisfied, and loving the smoothies.
customer_reviews.author: Sam A.

customer_reviews.title: They turned out more like a thick pulpy mixture than smooth
customer_reviews.text: The reason I purchased the Versa blender was it's description as being a clone to the much pricier Vitamix. It is not a clone. Not even close. We immediately started making our smoothies. They turned out more like a thick pulpy mixture than smooth. This is all I have used it for so far. I plan on "experimenting" with it and hopefully I will be a little more impressed. Right now? Wish I had waited and saved for the Vitamix.
customer_reviews.author: savetheanimals

customer_reviews.title: Great at first. But, problems show.
customer_reviews.text: It was a more affordable alternative to the Vitamix as recommended by Wirecutter. It served its purpose (albeit very loud) for about 2 years. Then, the ball-bearing metal bottom of the jar started to leak lubricant oil into the jar and outside. Who knows how long the toxic contaminant has been inside our smoothies and shakes. Amazon has only a 30day return policy and they recommended contacting the manufacturer directly since it's on a 7 year warranty. That process also looks cumbersome, time-consuming, and requires additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: MZ

customer_reviews.title: A Smoothie Maker Worth Buying
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a high speed blender to make smoothies and other blended drinks. After reading many reviews about different machines, we chose the Oster Versa. We chose the one with the shorter jar and are glad we did. It meets all of our needs. We use the smoothie setting most of the time. Mostly we make healthy smoothies, and so far couldn't be happier. This machine can handle frozen fruits and ice cubes with ease. Easy to clean and use. Would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Busick

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as blenders costing much more
customer_reviews.text: This blender is awesome. It's so powerful it sometimes scares me. I am very happy with the purchase. I would buy it again and recommend it to others - family and friends, who were interested in buying a blender. If you're considering one of those much more expensive blenders you owe it to yourself to check this one out. You might save a few bucks and be just as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Chambers

customer_reviews.title: For smoothies, frozen fruit takes more time than I expected. Smoothie programmed setting not useful.
customer_reviews.text: For smoothies, it did not cut through the frozen fruit as quickly as I had expected. But, MUCH better than my older blender, and did not vibrate!.
customer_reviews.author: AlexLitost

customer_reviews.title: This blender is the best ever, cleans easily
customer_reviews.text: This blender is the best ever, cleans easily, and works for everything. I went to visit family and had to use an old oster glass for a week and I could taste the difference in my shake. I use it for everything, its durable and works so well. I am not sure if it is better than a Vitamix because I got it to save the $200 b/c how much do you really want to spend on a blender but this one was well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea D. Thom

customer_reviews.title: The description lies about speed as 28000 RPM, the ...
customer_reviews.text: The description lies about speed as 28000 RPM, the official manufacturer site says 2800 RPM in the FAQ, it says "What are the watts of the Oster® Versa® blender? Answer: 1,400 watts, with 28,00 RPM's", the it can not fracture cells. I purchased with the only goal of cell fracturing. Liar
customer_reviews.author: Lee Hao

customer_reviews.title: Overheats easily
customer_reviews.text: Has worked OK for smoothies, but we were just blending one pitcher full of broccoli and sliced ham to make baby food and it overheated. We had to pause several times to let it cool. I expected better and would return it if it weren't too late.
customer_reviews.author: N. Long

customer_reviews.title: ... this blender and started using it I was really happy. The blender would handle everything I threw at ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first purchased this blender and started using it I was really happy. The blender would handle everything I threw at it which was mainly frozen fruit, oat meal, some spinach, and some small ice cubes. Unfortunately the machine could not handle that type of use on a regular basis and died. I was making a smoothy and then it started to smell like something was burning and next thing I know smoke is coming from the bottom of the machine. Really disappointing since I did not overload the machine or put in anything to cause this type of malfunction. Advice for future shoppers would be to save some extra coin and buy a more proven product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Villegas

customer_reviews.title: I would like it replaced with a blender that can take more ...
customer_reviews.text: Blender bought in Dec of 2015 and the blade assembly base is rusting and leaking - only recently used on a daily basis for smoothies. I would like it replaced with a blender that can take more than a couple months of daily use. I see the reviews from others with the same problem. FLAWED DESIGN
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service Lies About Warranty
customer_reviews.text: This blender stopped working after 3 uses. Nothing heavy-duty, just smoothies. Called customer service to find out what they could do since it has a 7 year warranty. I was told that it was not covered even though it was well within the warranty period. The person I talked to was very rude and unhelpful. They totally lie about their warranty and put out an inferior product. I will never buy another Oster product again!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Oster-iffic Blender
customer_reviews.text: This is just awesome. Esthetically, it looks baddass on my counter. Love the black and red. The booklet with recipes that came with it is a very nice touch and I love all the blender settings and it is powerful. I will state that for smoothies, I typically set it to smoothie 2x or 3 to get the perfectly blended smoothie. Money well spent. Did I say how amazing it looks on the counter?
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Does not last.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 1/2016. Fast forward to 10/2018 - After occasional use the motor drive ground itself to metal ribbons, some inner metal rings shattered to pieces, ball bearings fell out, motor left smoking. Not what I was expecting for the price and high reviews. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto C Tirado

customer_reviews.title: Forget the vitamix get this one
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, no need for a $300 Vitamix unless you really need a commercial blender with a constant rated duty cycle. This is everything you need in a blender unless you use one 16 hours a day. I'm a retired line cook and I hate cheap junk; this thing is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Post

customer_reviews.title: When it's working it's a great blender
customer_reviews.text: We've had this blender for nearly 4 years. In that time, we've had to replace the motor twice and it's just about to die for a third time. The blender is fantastic when it's working, but the hassle of it smoking and the motor grinding to a halt after a year is frustrating. One additional upside is that Oster was great about replacing the base of the blender every time the motor burned out.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Professional blender
customer_reviews.text: As good or better than blenders costing 3X, and has many functions.
customer_reviews.author: Far West

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the price and settings it has available
customer_reviews.text: I make smoothies often so this is perfect for a family that makes 4 smoothies at a clip 3-4 times a week. I also use it as my food processor for now. The pulse settings allow for me to have perfect control. Great price and looks nice too. I like the width of the blender as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy use, simple cleanup, and does a great job. We use this predominantly for smoothies (lots of greens, veges, frozen fruit...) , and it does a fantastic job 😀. Very pleased with this, and would definitely buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as a Vitamix or a Blendtec!
customer_reviews.text: This amazing blender seriously does it all - I have used this blender to create amazing salsas, smoothies, soups, and my personal favorite, super healthy, quick, homemade tomato sauce. My lasagna recipe is approximately 6 million percent tastier now that I'm using homemade sauce, and it tastes so fresh I could just sing about it. Great blender, super high powered, and looks great in my red and black kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Rusting
customer_reviews.text: We have had this blender for just over a month and the blade is rusting right in the center. I make sure to wash it immediately after each use. Nothing ever sits in it. Love it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Pruner

customer_reviews.title: A bit tall
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good blender, and I cant complain about anything. However, it is a little taller than most blenders so if you are redoing your kitchen, you may want to increase the distance between your counter-top and your cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: The Oster Versa exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The Oster Versa exceeded my expectations. It works great and is reasonably priced. The smoothies it makes are helping with my weight loss so I am very pleased. The only complaint I have is that this thing is loud.... L, O, U, D.... loud. In a small dwelling, if you are doing this while others are sleeping, you're likely to get a frying pan on the side of your head. I did not mark it down as it seems that all the comparable units are also crazy loud.
customer_reviews.author: Peter from Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Leaky Pitcher - Migrating Dial
customer_reviews.text: The pitcher started to leak prematurely. I would estimate that the blender had less than 20 hours of operation before this started happening (1-2 times a week for a few years). The dial on the blender would migrate and slowly back itself off if you were not holding the speed dial. As a result can't take you hand off the blender for more than 5 seconds without the it slowing down on you.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jadczak

customer_reviews.title: A Powerful Versatile Blender
customer_reviews.text: Great blender. We use it to make soups, sauces, smoothies, tofu, nut milks, and butters . . . it does everything we want it to do. I was expecting the high powered motor to be deafeningly loud, but it is actually quieter and less harsh sounding than our old 600 watt Oster Professional beehive style blender.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jackofsky

customer_reviews.title: We chose low profile for ease of use and storage and could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: We love it and have been making as many homemade healthy food options as we can find--saves us money and works just as well as the other $800/$900 blenders that friends have had to return within a few months. I waited a few months to write review to ensure we would not have same issue
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Ran good for two years - then the motor burned up ...
customer_reviews.text: Ran good for two years - then the motor burned up - lots smoke. Will try contacting the vendor about its 7 year limited warranty on the motor. Update: Called customer service and received a free replacement - same model - very pleased with this company's products warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Blue fossils

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased with the Oster Versa
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with the Oster Versa. I have only had it a few days but I have used it everyday. It makes wonderful smoothies. I'm wanting to try out the spread function...I want to make my own peanut butter. I believe this blender will be a keeper. It's powerful enough to do most anything. Thank you Amazon for the great service and products.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Solid design with the all-metal drive and convenient features with a high level of control.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Buy frozen fruits/berries from costco and toss a bunch in with some milk and ice for a super-fast and delicious start to the day. I have had a smoothie party before where we go out and buy ingredients we want to try to make smoothies out of. Good times. Cleaning can take longer than actually blending, but it's definitely worth it. Solid design with the all-metal drive and convenient features with a high level of control.
customer_reviews.author: SHOCK

customer_reviews.title: motor stopped and wouldn't turn on again
customer_reviews.text: Started up making a banana smoothie and had the motor stop during my first use of the blender and would not turn back on. I know that Vitamix blenders have overheat breakers and that you can just wait a bit for the motor to cool down - waited a day and still wouldn't turn on. Sent back and received a replacement a couple weeks later. Almost the exact same experience as the first one. Returned it for a refund and have opted to go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Justin E.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid for smoothies; doesn't reduce frozen items to slush
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a dead Breville. It does a poor job blending any frozen items larger than a blueberry. Ice, and frozen strawberries and banana chunks, only get reduced to smaller pieces, not smoothly blended liquid as they would in the Breville. This was the case either with the smoothie preset or when turning the machine to high. Unless you only prepare smoothies with unfrozen ingredients, or smallish frozen items, save your money for a Vitamix, or buy a Breville with Amazon's product protection or via a credit card that extends a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Fraleigh

customer_reviews.title: 3+ years on still works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it a 4 because the blender's jar's looks deteriorate over time and after much use. Would love to have the option of a glass jar, better, longer lasting and healthier, no plastics... But, still love it; recommend it to anyone wanting a high power all purpose blender. By the way, I use it for heavy blending of smoothies and not a single wear and tear issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great with ice
customer_reviews.text: We really like the Oster Versa Pro blender. We use it almost every day for health shakes made with ice. The power of this blender is great and it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: A. Searls

customer_reviews.title: It worked great up until about the 8th use
customer_reviews.text: It worked great up until about the 8th use, less than a month. While making a simple smoothie, it became ear-splitting loud, sliding on the counter (this thing is heavy) and the smell of burning plastic was noticeable. Something was rattling too; I believe the metal gear and/or the blade had become slightly loose. It really is a shame too. I had made perfect hummus, smoothies, cashew cream up to that point... Spent a good 6-8 hours online reading reviews before I settled on the Versa. I should be getting a full refund once always quality receives the blender. Now, I'm split between the Ninja Ultima and Cleanblend!
customer_reviews.author: john tongate

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Works almost as well as a vita mix. Well enough for the price difference.
customer_reviews.author: GoDiveMaui

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy this blender!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this blender. Only had it for a few days but in those day I have blended everything from nuts to soups and the results were amazing. Definitely excited to up my culinary skills. The hard part now is having to eat everything I make so I can make something new. Lol Pros: Cleaning is a breeze, just cycle water through, you can throw just about anything into it, fun to cook again. Cons: Frozen strawberries do not get chopped all the way through in one cycle, need to figure that out. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Optimistic
customer_reviews.text: It's everything it's advertised as being. So far it's made quick and easy work of pureeing a large sweet potato. I doubt I'll test it with anything more difficult that that. All that remains are years of dependability and from the look of it, I'm optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Graham

customer_reviews.title: Jar Blade mechanism failed after 2 and half years use.
customer_reviews.text: Had this blender for a little over 2 years. and now the blade mechanism on the jar failed and is now leaking. Tried to find replacement jars with no luck.
customer_reviews.author: David C Qualman

customer_reviews.title: A Real disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: owned if for about 3 months before it started not working. It was stuck. The bearings and rings in the pitcher went bad. Impossible to replace. We made smoothies in the morning for breakfast with fruit and milk. This blender can't handle anything frozen. My cheap 12$ walmart blender out lasted it. It would overheat very easily and we would have to wait for it to cool down and then restart it. This would happen from day one. If you plan on blending nuts or frozen fruit, pass on this one. Also Very Very loud.
customer_reviews.author: Cschneiderheinze

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: A powerhouse, this blender makes short work of just about anything. Heavy duty, as easy to clean as any blender.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kane

customer_reviews.title: I am so happy that I bought this Oster Versa instead of spending ...
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I bought this Oster Versa instead of spending hundreds more on a vitamix. It has met all my needs. UPDATED 6/12/2017 -- Had a little problem with my blender, checked Oster's website, found a phone number and called.... A brand new blender is on the way to my house. No hassle! Oster has me as a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: The Freelys

customer_reviews.title: This blender has excellent power. I love the smoothie and soup one-button ...
customer_reviews.text: This blender has excellent power. I love the smoothie and soup one-button push settings. However, after several months of nearly daily use, I've found the gasket around the lid has loosened. While it still works, it's floppy and hard to wrangle into place when setting the lid. Also, I made sauce in the blender which had turmeric - that stained the plastic vessel for several weeks before it gradually wore away.
customer_reviews.author: Garnet

customer_reviews.title: and tough greens like kale and spinach
customer_reviews.text: I am on the green smoothie bandwagon. So, I need a blender I can use daily, that can handle bunches of frozen fruit, and tough greens like kale and spinach. This blender powers through everything I've thrown at it without a glitch. And, saved me tons of money. This is a great blender and I'm very happy I got it.
customer_reviews.author: LJE2025

customer_reviews.title: Manufactory is not available to back they products
customer_reviews.text: had to buy a new blender because we could not get in touch with the manufactory to order the part we needed. Beware the drive wheel will ware out.
customer_reviews.author: WEM3

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but not quite as well as my moms Vitamix. The Vitamix fully blends chia seeds. Sometimes the Versa doesn't blend them completely. I got this during a flash sale and the quality for the price I paid cannot be beat. Makes great smoothies, protein shakes and salsa. Easy to clean and the book with all the recipes is great.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela E

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my wife as she loves to make smoothies and with a newborn at home, she was constantly pureeing food. The blender was a dud. Foods do not blend well unless you add a ton of liquid. She didn't want to water down food for the baby nor did she want to add useless juices or water to her smoothies. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford j Hilton

customer_reviews.title: It's great..
customer_reviews.text: It's great... powerful enough for everything you need. I make green smoothies daily (kale/spinach and frozen fruit) daily, almond and cashew butter on the weekends, etc. This blender is just as good as the Vitamix... you'll love either one you go with.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: This is a great blender for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blender for the price. Can handle pretty much anything you put in it. For value, this would be the best blender to get. Still using long after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Biddle

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this super blender
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with this super blender. It's a powerhouse at an affordable price. I use it to make soups and smoothies. Works like a charm, easy cleanup. Nice styling and good quality. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemmons

customer_reviews.title: Great blender
customer_reviews.text: Once you use 1400 Watts, you can't go back. If it overloads, there's a reset button on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: JCG

product_meta.title: Oster Versa Blender | 1400 Watts | Stainless Steel Blade | Low Profile Jar | Perfect for Smoothies, Soups, Black
product_meta.description: Powerful performance within reach. The Oster Versa Pro series blender is the perfect blend of high speed Power, precision and proven performance to ensure the freshest, healthiest blending possible. Make healthy smoothies from whole fruits, vegetables, and more Or nutritious dishes for optimal nutrition. Its powerful 1400-watt motor and 250 mph blade speed blend foods to the perfect consistency and freshest taste. Make the most of your ingredients and explore the blend abilities.
feature_bullets: Three programmed settings (smoothies, dips/spreads and Soup) and variable speed dial to instantly adjust speed as needed
Stainless steel blade spins at over 250 mph thoroughly blending ingredients so recipes turn out Perfect every time
Includes 2 color cookbooks with recipes to inspire you; 7 year
Dimensions: H: 12. 1 inches X W: 16. 8 inches X L: 11. 6 inches , cord length: 16 inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars891 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
